'''Valandil''' was the father of [[Elendil]] according to the early version of the [[legendarium]] in ''[[The Lost Road]]''.

== History ==
When [[Herendil]] informed his father that though the two of them are the blood of kings, his peers called him names such as "Terendul" the day prior, and accused him of being a "half-Noldo",<ref name=P1/> [[Elendil]] responded by saying that then it may be dangerous for Herendil to be his son as his own father's name, Valandil, meant ''"God-friend"''.<ref name=P1>{{LR|P1III2}}</ref>

Later. Elendil tells his son that he cannot be corrupted by the servants of [[Morgoth]] due to being Valandil his father being the "chief of the wise men of [[Númenor]].<ref name=P1/>

== Etymology ==
''Valandil'' is [[Quenya]], being a compound of ''vanan'' ("god") + ''(-n)dil'' ("friend"). Its [[Old English]] cognate was ''[[Oswin Errol|Oswine]]'', which also means "God-friend".<ref>{{LR|P1III1}}</ref>

== Other versions of the legendarium ==
In another stage of the [[Legendarium]] separate from ''[[The Lost Road]]'', Valandil was the brother of [[Elendil]] the Tall. In this stage, Valandil had the role of [[Anarion]] and founded [[Gondor|Ondor]].<ref>{{LR|P1II4}}, pp. 33-4</ref>
